instruction: Gather your mixture of sprouting seeds and the container.
tip: Metal containers or wide-mouth mason jars work best for seed soaking.

instruction: Rinse the sprouting seeds with cool water (around 70​ degrees F) and drain.
tip: Make sure to remove any debris, broken seeds, or stones that are still remaining in the sprouting seed mixture.

instruction: Place the rinsed seeds in a container and fill about 3⁄4 of the container with cool water. Soaking time should be around 8 hours, or overnight.
tip: To allow air to flow properly, cover the container with a mesh lid or cloth and secure it with a rubber band.

instruction: After the soaking period is over, drain the sprouts well, while allowing for plenty of air circulation.
tip: A mesh strainer works best, as it prevents any smaller seeds from getting lost with the draining water.

instruction: Repeat the rinsing and draining process for the next 2-3 days for around 3 times a day.
tip: Use cool water and to rinse gently to avoid damaging the tender sprouts.

instruction: Before the sprouts appear ready, rinse them one more time in cool water. After you drain them, your sprouts are now ready to eat!
tip: Remove any unsprouted seeds and seed hulls, if you desire.
